title: Performance Budgets and Load Testing
summary: Define measurable performance targets and provide a load-testing harness to validate them.
description: Set performance budgets (e.g., TTFP targets for primary views, API p95/p99 latencies) and add an automated load-test harness (k6 or similar) to validate the budgets.

components.name: Budgets
components.responsibility: Document targets for primary pages and APIs.

components.name: Load Tests
components.responsibility: Provide scripts and CI job to run load tests and record results.

components.name: Reporting
components.responsibility: Store/load test artifacts and provide guidance to interpret results.

interactions: CI can optionally run a short smoke load test on preview builds.
Load tests run against a production-like environment and report pass/fail based on thresholds.
Perf budgets reviewed when UI or API changes are made that may regress performance.
acceptance_criteria: One automated load test script exists and can be run locally/CI.
Load test results are archived as CI artifacts when run.
tasks: Define budgets for homepage and critical API endpoints.
Add a simple k6 script for the homepage and an API endpoint and document run steps.
Add a CI job to optionally run a short load smoke test on demand.
